column1:
Hey,

I don't know who is going to read this, but I thought I would post because I have dropped off the face of the earth for so long.
column2: Sorry it's been such a long time.&nbsp
column3:
One of my online friends from years ago messaged me and it made me feel guilty about not posting or anything.

Well, about a year and a half ago I got a very persistent Crohn's flare that had me in bed for a long time.
column4: It wasn't that bad, but it made me very lethargic.&nbsp
column5: I didn't post online much or go outside.&nbsp
column6: I really just focused on my writing.&nbsp
column7: Thankfully, Pierce was understanding and was very patient with me.&nbsp
column8: I snapped out of if back in January 2009.&nbsp
column9: Once I recovered, I didn't really want to go back to spending half my days on the internet anymore.&nbsp
column10: I used to be obsessed with online communities and television and I didn't want to be like that anymore.&nbsp
column12: Since then I've been focusing on my work.
column13: I became a teacher shortly after Crohn's disease went back into remission.&nbsp
column14: I teach at an international boarding school in <st1:country-region><st1:place>South&nbsp
column16: Mostly, I work with Elementary students, but I teach literature and writing to older students sometimes.&nbsp
column18: I'm also publishing a lot more now.&nbsp
column19: Pierce and I are still together, though he's still living in
column21: Once the academic year is over we're planning on going back to <st1:state><st1:place>Iowa</st1:place></st1:state> -- of all places -- to get married.&nbsp
column22: You should have seen my face when I heard <st1:state><st1:place>Iowa</st1:place></st1:state> legalized gay marriage a year after I moved.&nbsp
column23:
Well, I hope I haven't offend the lot of you for disappearing for so long.

~S



"

column1: event,"This is now a friends only journal.  If you want to be added, leave a comment in this post."
